This high-contrast filter retains only yellow and dark blue colours. Use it on well-lit streets of a night city.
A colour scheme commonly used in movies adds green to the darker areas. This filter works well for high-contrast scenes such as dusk in the city.
This unique combination of colours works perfect in cloudy weather and soft light.
Enhanced colours

Welcome to Camera! Tagging your photos and videos with the locations where they are taken will make your Gallery more organised and help you find items faster. Some features might not be available if you restrict adding location info.

We shall protect your personal information in accordance with the relevant laws, regulations, and privacy policies.
Read and agree to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy before using this app.
To fully understand your rights as a user as well as the ways in which we use your data, read and agree to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy.

"Camera needs to connect to the internet to provide effects, music, and other features for short videos.

By tapping \"Agree\" below, you're agreeing to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy, and allowing Camera to connect to the internet."

Welcome to short videos! Our service needs to connect to the network to provide you with music and other features.

Before using our service, you need to read and agree to our User Agreement and Privacy Policy, as well as allow the app to connect to the internet.

Turn on Bluetooth and Wi-Fi in Control centre to be able to use Dual phone recording.
Turn on Bluetooth and WLAN in Control center to be able to use Dual phone recording.
Close feature description
Feature description

Saturation allows you to control the depth and intensity of colours, adjusting contrast brings out or minimises the difference between light and dark, and sharpness renders the details along the outlines.

Average metering takes into account all areas of your image, working best for evenly lit scenes. Centre-weighted metering mainly focuses on the central area of the frame and gives due consideration to the brightness of the surrounding area, which is suitable for shooting subjects in the centre of the frame. Spot metering only covers the area in one spot, giving you precise control over the exposure.
